message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations:
2x + 3y = 11
4x - 5y = -13
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations, we can use the method of substitution or elimination. In this case, we will use the elimination method.

First, we will make the coefficients of either x or y the same in both equations. We can do this by multiplying the first equation by 2. This will give us:

4x + 6y = 22 (1st equation multiplied by 2)
4x - 5y = -13 (2nd equation)

Now, we will subtract the second equation from the first equation to eliminate the x variable:

(4x + 6y) - (4x - 5y) = 22 - (-13)

This simplifies to:

11y = 35

Now, we will solve for y by dividing both sides by 11:

y = 35 / 11
y = 3.1818 (rounded to four decimal places)

Now that we have the value of y, we can substitute it back into either the first or second equation to solve for x. We will use the first equation:

2x + 3y = 11
2x + 3(3.1818) = 11

This simplifies to:

2x + 9.5454 = 11

Now, we will solve for x by subtracting 9.5454 from both sides:

2x = 1.4546

Finally, we will divide both sides by 2:

x = 1.4546 / 2
x = 0.7273 (rounded to four decimal places)

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 0.7273
y = 3.1818
